articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday held talks with U.S. President Donald Trump by phone, China's state-run news agency Xinhua reported, as bilateral relations have been strained by trade disputes.
articles.title: Xi, Trump hold phone talks, Xinhua reports

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Crispian Balmer, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The U.N. Security Council is also set to vote on a demand for a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas and humanitarian access across Gaza.
articles.title: US signals veto of UN Security Council demand for Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Sabine Siebold, Lili Bayer
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Thursday he was confident that members of the NATO alliance would sign up to Donald Trump's demand for a major boost in defence spending, adding that it had to happen by a summit later in June.
articles.title: Pentagon chief confident NATO will commit to Trump's defence spending target

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military recovered the bodies of two hostages, Judi Weinstein-Haggai and Gad Haggai, who were held by Hamas, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli military recovers bodies of two hostages held by Hamas, prime minister says

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Nandita Bose
articles.description: The proclamation fully restricts the entry of nationals from 12 countries including Afghanistan, Haiti and Iran. The entry of people from seven other countries will be partially restricted.
articles.title: Trump bans nationals from 12 countries, citing security concerns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian aircraft were damaged but not destroyed in a June 1 attack by Ukraine, and they will be restored, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said in an interview with the state news agency TASS.
articles.title: Russia says it will repair bombers damaged by Ukraine's drones

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Joseph Ax
articles.description: The man charged with fire-bombing a Colorado march by people who wanted to raise awareness of Israeli hostages in Gaza is scheduled to be formally charged in state court on Thursday, as those he targeted vowed to carry on their efforts.
articles.title: Colorado fire-bomb suspect to make court appearance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The rate of young children suffering from acute malnutrition in Gaza has nearly tripled since a ceasefire earlier this year when aid flowed more freely, according to data collected by humanitarian groups and released by the U.N. on Thursday.
articles.title: Rate of Gaza children suffering acute malnutrition rate nearly triples, survey shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A minor earthquake in southern Italy has caused the partial collapse of a wall and a portion of a vault at the Pompeii archaeological site, authorities said on Thursday.
articles.title: Earthquake damages part of Pompeii site in southern Italy

articles.author: Ryan Jones
articles.description: The Trump administration has moved to end deportation protections the United States granted to thousands of Nepalese people after a 2015 earthquake devastated the country, according to a government notice posted on Thursday.
articles.title: Trump administration ending protected status for Nepalese migrants
